title: Takayuki Kinoshita
text:
is a Japanese racing car driver, author, and automotive journalist. Kinoshita is affiliated with <a href="Toyota%20Motorsport">Toyota Motorsport</a>'s GAZOO Racing arm, with whom he scored SP8 class wins in the 2010, 2012, and 2014 <a href="24%20Hours%20N%C3%BCrburgring">24 Hours Nürburgring</a> driving the <a href="Lexus%20LFA">Lexus LFA</a>. He also won A8 class in the 2004 24 Hours Nürburgring driving a <a href="Nissan%20Skyline%20GT-R">Nissan Skyline GT-R</a> (R34) for <a href="Falken%20Motorsports">Falken Motorsports</a>.
Among Japanese drivers, Kinoshita has raced the most times in the <a href="24%20Hours%20N%C3%BCrburgring">24 Hours Nürburgring</a>. He has also raced in <a href="All%20Japan%20Grand%20Touring%20Car%20Championship">All Japan Grand Touring Car Championship</a>, <a href="Japanese%20Touring%20Car%20Championship">Japanese Touring Car Championship</a>, <a href="Japanese%20Formula%20Three">Japanese Formula Three</a>, and .
Kinoshita is a member of the and is on the selection committee for <a href="Car%20of%20the%20Year%20Japan">Car of the Year Japan</a>. He was also a presenter on the Japanese <a href="Best%20Motoring">Best Motoring</a> TV series.
